info.description:
This is the swagger specification for Api-X REST API

Examples can be found at: https://docs.xenit.eu/alfred-api
info.title: Api-X REST API

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3

The Swagger Spec for Alfred API
Shows this swagger spec in a user interface

post.summary: Returns combined information of multiple nodes. Nodes errors or without appropriate permissions will not be included in return, and will not cause failure of the call.
post.description:
Example to get combined information of multiple nodes:

```
POST /apix/v1/nodes/nodeInfo
{
"retrieveMetadata" : true, 
"retrievePath" : true, 
"retrievePermissions" : true, 
"retrieveAssocs" : true, 
"retrieveChildAssocs" : true, 
"retrieveParentAssocs" : true, 
"retrieveTargetAssocs" : true, 
"noderefs": [ 
  "workspace://SpacesStore/123456789", 
  "workspace://SpacesStore/147258369", 
  "workspace://SpacesStore/478159236" 
]}
```
'retrieveMetadata', 'retrievePath', 'retrievePermissions', 'retrieveAssocs', 'retrieveChildAssocs',
'retrieveParentAssocs', 'retrieveTargetAssocs' are optional parameters.
Set 'retrieveMetadata' to false to omit the aspects and properties from the result.
Set 'retrievePath' to false to omit the path from the result.
Set 'retrievePermissions' to false to omit the permissions from the result.
Set 'retrieveAssocs' to false to omit the associations(parent associations, child associations, peer associations) from the result.
Set 'retrieveChildAssocs' to false to omit the child associations from the result.
Set 'retrieveParentAssocs' to false to omit the parent associations from the result.
Set 'retrieveTargetAssocs' to false to omit the peer target associations from the result.
Set 'retrieveSourceAssocs' to false to omit the peer source associations from the result. Note: versionstore does not support sourceAssocs. For version nodes, an empty list added to the result

parameters.name: parent

parameters.name: type

parameters.name: extractMetadata
parameters.description: Enable metadata extraction from the content, for example for msg files

get.summary: Retrieves the ancestors of the nodes
get.description:
It is possible to add "root" as a request parameter.
It is the node reference up to which point ancestors will be retrieved.
The default root reference will be the reference of Company Home

get.summary:
Retrieve node associations.
Versionstore does not support sourceAssocs. For version nodes, an empty list is returned for this component of the result.

delete.summary: Sets the content for given node to empty

Checks if the given node exists
Retrieve node metadata

post.description:
Example to set a node's title and add the sys:versionable aspect:

```
POST /apix/v1/nodes/workspace/SpacesStore/b54287de-381e-44b1-b6d1-e6c9a9d632fd/metadata
{
  "aspectsToAdd": ["{http://www.alfresco.org/model/system/1.0}temporary"],
  "propertiesToSet": {"{http://www.alfresco.org/model/content/1.0}title":["My new title"]}
}
```

When you generalize the type of a node instead of specializing, the default properties of the initial **type** that are not present in the new type are removed, however, the default aspects are not. This is the default behaviour. If you also want to remove these aspects on type generalization, add the parameter **cleanUpAspectsOnGeneralization** to the request body.

Example for cleaning up aspects on type generalization:

```
POST /apix/v1/nodes/workspace/SpacesStore/b54287de-381e-44b1-b6d1-e6c9a9d632fd/metadata
{
  "type": "{http://www.alfresco.org/model/content/1.0}content",
  "cleanUpAspectsOnGeneralization": true
}
```

Changing the cm:name property will also update the qname path of the node so it is in sync with it.
This only applies to nodes of type or subtype cm:content or cm:folder but not of type or subtype of cm:systemfolder.

get.description: Returns a key-value map of permissions keys to a value of 'DENY' or 'ALLOW'. Possible keys are: Read, Write, Delete, CreateChildren, ReadPermissions, ChangePermissions, or custom permissions

post.summary: sets a user a permission for a node.

delete.summary: removes a user its permission for a node.

get.summary: Returns person information given a userName
Returns person information
Return the definition of a property

post.description: # Request components ## query Object containing subcomponents that build the requested query. Info about the Search query syntax can be found here: https://docs.xenit.eu/alfred-api/user/rest-api ### special search terms: - type: searches for nodes of that type (for example: "type" : "cm:content") - aspect: searches for nodes with that aspect (for example: "aspect" : "cm:titled") - noderef: searches the node with that noderef (for example: "noderef" : "workspace://SpacesStore/f0d15919-3841-4170-807f-b81d2ebdeb80") - parent: searches the nodes with that parent (for example: "parent" : "workspace://SpacesStore/f0d15919-3841-4170-807f-b81d2ebdeb80") - path: searches the nodes with that path (for example: "path" : "/") - category: searches the nodes with that category (for example: "category" : "workspace://SpacesStore/f0d15919-3841-4170-807f-b81d2ebdeb80") - text: searches the nodes with content containing that text (for example: "text" : "this text") - all: searches the nodes with content, cm:name, cm:creator, cm:modifier or cm:author containing the value (for example: "all" : "search term") - isunset: searches the nodes with where the value of the property is not set (for example: "isunset" : "cm:author") - isnull: searches the nodes with where the value of the property is null (for example: "isnull" : "cm:author") - isnotnull: searches the nodes with where the value of the property is not null (for example: "isnotnull" : "cm:author") - exists: searches the nodes that have the property (for example: "exists" : "cm:author") ## paging `Optional` Options to skip over results starting from the top of the result and to limit the total number of results. ## facets `Optional` Options to enable, limit the total amount, minimum number of hits and customize input of facets. Note: facets with 0 hits are not returned in the result ## orderBy `Optional` Options to select the property to order by and the direction of sorting. ## consistency `Optional` Option to request specific consistency ## locale `Optional` Options to request specific locale and encoding options ## workspace `Optional` Options to change the target alfresco workspace ## highlight `5.2 and up` `Optional` Options to change the highlight configuration. Minimal requirement is the `fields` array, which takes object containing at least the `field` property. Each list element specifies a property on which higlighting needs to be applied. When no fields are specified, the call defaults to `cm:content` as field. Full documentation can be found on the alfresco [documentation](https://docs.alfresco.com/5.2/concepts/search-api-highlight.html) page. # Examples Search for the first 10 nodes in the `cm:content` namespace: ```json { "query": {"type":"{http://www.alfresco.org/model/content/1.0}content"}, "paging": { "limit": 10, "skip": 0 }, "facets": { "enabled": false } } ``` Search for all nodes with the term 'budget' in the `cm:content` property (fulltext), and show two highlighted hits with delimiter \\: ```json { "query": { "property": { "exact": false, "name": "cm:content", "value": "budget" } }, "highlight":{ "prefix":"", "postfix":"", "snippetCount":2, "fields":[{"field":"cm:content"}] } } ```

get.summary: Retrieves information about the available sites of the current user
get.description:
Returns a list of sites. For each site the node reference, short name, title, description,
site visibility and list of site components (document libray, links, data lists, wiki,
discussions) are returned.

There are no mandatory request parameters. However, there are optional ones:
Set 'retrieveMetadata' to true to return the aspects and properties of the sites.
Set 'retrievePath' to true to return the path of the sites.
Set 'retrievePermissions' to true to return the permissions of the sites.
Set 'retrieveChildAssocs' to true to return the child associations of the sites.
Set 'retrieveParentAssocs' to true to return the parent associations of the sites.
Set 'retrieveTargetAssocs' to true to return the target peer associations of the sites.
Set 'retrieveSourceAssocs' to true to return the source peer associations of the sites.

post.description: Returns the noderef of the original node

Returns a list containing all groups

destinationFolder.description: Optional, if not specified uses the original node's folder. If current user does not have permissions for this folder, the working copy is created in the user's home folder

limit.description: Limits the number of values returned per facet

mincount.description: Return only facet values with count >= mincount

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code of the sub call

body.description: JSON result body of the sub call
